author: Staff Reporter
text:
Purification of electoral rolls is under way in Krishnagiri. In accordance with the Election Commission directive, purification of the roll entails special field inquiries for removal of the names of deceased voters; voter names that have appeared twice with same EPIC numbers; voters who have moved base and are no longer in the given addresses.

According to the administration, field inquiries on the electoral discrepancies are made based on the voter lists handed over by accredited representatives of recognised political parties.

The revised list under the aforementioned heads will be displayed for the scrutiny of the public and the political parties in the offices of Election Registry offices, offices of Sub Collectors, Revenue Divisional Office, taluk offices, and Municipal commissioner’s offices here.

The names of the voters removed from the draft list will be read out in a special gram sabha scheduled for February 22 for verification.

The deletion of the names will be finally made from the electoral roll on February 29.

According an administration release, the number of redundancies in names has been particularly found in Hosur taluk. Voters are requested to come forward to have their names deleted, where it has been appeared twice.
title: Electoral rolls purification exercise under way in Krishnagiri
